hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Volatility Compression Reversal
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a high-impact news event (e.g., major regulatory headline), a sharp, high-volume price spike (>3% in 15 minutes) followed by 2 hours of price compression (range < 0.5% of spike magnitude) will lead to a continuation move in the original spike direction within the next 4 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news creates institutional positioning. The compression represents absorption/equilibrium before directional resolution. Elevated IV suggests unresolved uncertainty, favoring breakout over mean reversion.
entry_conditions: BTC or ETH experiences >3% absolute move in 15-min candle on 2x+ average volume
Subsequent 8 consecutive 15-min candles (2 hours) trade in a range < 0.5% of the initial spike's magnitude
RSI(14) on 15-min chart between 40-60 (neutral) at end of compression
Implied volatility (Deribit BTC/ETH DVOL) remains elevated (>5% above 24hr average)

exit_conditions.time_exit: 4 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of qualifying setups result in a false breakout (reverse to fill >75% of initial spike) before hitting TP.
